channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: High stakes on the high seas as US, China test limits of military power
item.description: US Navy destroyer confronts China near Scarborough Shoal as naval power shifts in Indo-Pacific. Military experts warn of growing Chinese capabilities.

item.title: From Jamie Dimon to Bill Ackman, Wall Street’s billionaires are now changing their tune and offering to help Zohran Mamdani
item.description: Over $22 million was spent by billionaires to prevent the democratic socialist from becoming mayor-elect, estimates say.

item.title: What Jay Jones' victory means for Democrats and the 'new era of violent rhetoric,' according to experts

item.title: Delta CEO Ed Bastian rejected a mentor’s advice for how to run the $38 billion airline: ‘He told me I’ll never have a moment of peace’
item.description: Delta CEO Ed Bastian says he reads through thousands of customer emails while flying in coach.

item.title: Trump’s Taxing Supreme Court Argument
item.description: If tariffs are taxes — and they are — they can’t be imposed by presidents without very clear directions from Congress.

item.title: The Nationalization of Elections Is Anti-American
item.description: Our Founding Fathers fought for our right not to care about who New Jersey elects as governor.

item.title: It Is Time to Be Done with Shutdowns
item.description: We’re five weeks into a government shutdown. It should be the last one.

item.title: The only phone notifications Jamie Dimon gets are from his kids—everyone else has to call the office
item.description: "If you send me a text during the day, I probably do not read it," Dimon said.

item.title: Founders are getting huge paydays before their startups are close to an exit—and that’s fine with many VCs
item.description: Venture firms don’t like to talk about early stage secondary sales but the practice is common in bull markets.
